3.43 
Separation of spouses and award of maintenance 
1. In order to protect the legitimate interests of one of the spouses, the court may, if possible, order the spouses to separate pending the outcome of the proceedings for annulment of their marriage. 
2. The court, when declaring the marriage void, must resolve the issues of maintenance of the minor children and of the spouse in good faith, as well as determine the place of residence of the minor children and the arrangements for their participation in their upbringing and for the minor children's access to the separated parent.
